course_main_structural_unit.address:
Nooruse 1
50411 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
Students will be asigned into groups of 3 to 4 people. Each team will build a robot that complies with the rules of Robotex (http://www.robotex.ee). 
Building a robot consists of:
    building a chassis
    installing of sensors
    the interconnecting of sensors and actuators with microcontrollers
    programming of microcontrollers
    testing of finished solution
All students with some knowledge in mechanics, low level programming, high level programming or project and team management are welcome.
Each team will be composed in such a way that the skills of members will complement eachother.
To attend the course, you will need to attend the kickoff camp. More information will be given in the first lecture.
description.et: Töö toimub 3-4 liikmelistes rühmades. Iga rühm ehitab roboti, mis vastab Robotex võistluse (http://www.robotex.ee) tingimustele. Kõik rühmad osalevad võistlusel, kus selgitatakse välja parim robot. Roboti ehitamine sisaldab roboti kere ehitust, andurite paigaldamist, mootorite ja andurite ühendamist mikroprotsessoriga, mikroprotsessori programmeerimist ja terviklahenduse testimist. Osaleda võivad kõik üliõpilased, kellel on teadmisi mehaanikas, mikroprotsessortehnikas või programmeerimises ning projektijuhtimises. Rühmad komplekteeritakse nii, et igaühes oleks esindatud roboti ehitamiseks vajalik kompetents. Kursusel osalemiseks on vaja avaüritusest osa võtta. Täpsem info esimeses loengus.

objectives.en: The purpose of the course is to teach to use knowledge and practical know-how in electronics, mechanics, mechantronics, design and management of mechatroncs project and teamwork. During the course student teams will build a robot which succeeds in performing a predefined task.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärk on õpetada kasutama ning omandada praktilisi oskusi elektroonikas, mehaanikas, mehhatroonika projekti juhtimises, disainis ning meeskonnatöös. Kursus toimub intensiivse meeskonnatöö vormis, kus piiratud aja jooksul tuleb valmis ehitada nö. robot, mis täidab etteantud ülesanded.

learning_outcomes.en: Finish a hardware project in a group where time is of the essence. Quickly aqcuire missing knowledge.
learning_outcomes.et: Oskus realiseerida riistvaraline projekt grupitöökorras, kiirelt omandada vajalikud lisateadmised ning osata meeskonnana funktsioneerida

notes.et: Kickoff meeting takes place 2018-09-06 18:15 in Physicum, room B103. On September 8th and 9th there will be 2 day bootcamp. During the event you will be trained to build a robot and the teams will be formed.

description.et: To get a positive grade, one must work in a teams and follow predefined tasks to build a basketball robot for Robotex.

grade_preconditions.et: Weekly tasks have to be completed

grade_evaluation.et:
Tasks must be completed to build a Robotex basketball robot. Tasks will earn points for your team and those points are used for grading. Weekly tasks can give your team a total of 100 points. Challenge tasks can give your team additional 33 bonus points. Bonus points are also available for weekly tasks.

Grade points:
100..91 A
90..81 B
80..71 C
70..61 D
60..51 E
50..0 F

https://digilabor.ut.ee/index.php/2018_Robotex_Grading_and_tasks

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
